intro: Rhabdadenia sagrae, commonly known as the Sagrae's candelabra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its branching, succulent stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
